definition: things are very different now (idiom)/times have changed
now/the present time/current/contemporary/this (day, year etc)
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
former times/the past/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
surname Xi
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: Remind FeiEr exhibition peng, to pay more attention to their image.
sentences.chinese: 展鹏提醒非儿今非昔比，要多注意自己的形象。

sentences.english: But the mood in the MECC exhibition centre was strangely muted this year.
sentences.chinese: 但今年MECC展览中心的气氛却今非昔比。

sentences.english: Mr. Cassano said it is a different fire department from what it was.
sentences.chinese: 卡萨诺说，现在的消防部门已今非昔比。

sentences.english: Twenty-five years ago, life science research was a different ball game.
sentences.chinese: 相比25年前，生命科学研究早已今非昔比。

sentences.english: They don't realize, he said, that circumstances have changed.
sentences.chinese: 王星说，“他们没有认识到，目前的形势已今非昔比。

sentences.english: Poor Mr Janes is sure not like he used to be; well he is over the hill.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的琼斯先生确是今非昔比，他已是日落西山了。

sentences.english: At the outset of her career she was full of optimism but not now.
sentences.chinese: 始十分乐观，但现在已今非昔比了。

definition: lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: General Lü Meng 呂蒙|吕蒙 of the southern state of Wu (idiom); model of self-improvement by diligent study (from unlettered soldier to top strategist of Wu)
this day and age (dialect)
bird shotgun replaced by cannon (idiom); equipment improved enormously
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to advance by leaps and bounds
lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
to not need dwell on (idiom)
now/at the present (time)
to be already so/already
lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
things are not as good as they used to be

lit. even a scrawny camel is bigger than a horse (idiom)/fig. even after suffering a loss, a rich person is still better off than ordinary people/a cultured person may come down in the world, but he is still superior to the common people
pinyin: shou4 si3 de5 luo4 tuo5 bi3 ma3 da4

definition: lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
